pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:0.5.eng: 28. The training rule on boarding boats

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were boarding boats by arrangement with nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.4.pli: “yatheva mayaṃ sapajāpatikā nāvāya kīḷāma, evamevime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya nāvāya kīḷantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.4.eng: “Just as we enjoy ourselves on boats with our wives, so these Sakyan monastics make arrangements with the nuns and then enjoy themselves on boats.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.7.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six board boats by arrangement with nuns?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.14.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya, uddhaṅgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk boards a boat by arrangement with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.15.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.15.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū ca bhikkhuniyo ca sāketā sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of monks and nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.2.eng: On the way they needed to cross a river.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.3.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo te bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.3.eng: The nuns said to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.5.pli: “Na, bhaginī, kappati bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhituṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.5.eng: “Sisters, it’s not allowable for us to board a boat by arrangement with a nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.6.pli: tumhe vā paṭhamaṃ uttaratha mayaṃ vā uttarissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.6.eng: Either you cross first, or we will.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.9.pli: Atha kho tāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ pacchā uttarantīnaṃ corā acchindiṃsu ca dūsesuñca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.9.eng: But because the nuns crossed afterwards, they were robbed and raped by bandits.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.10.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.10.eng: When they arrived at Sāvatthī they told the nuns there what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.11.eng: The nuns then told the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.12.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.13.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.14.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tiriyaṃ taraṇāya bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.14.eng: “Monks, I allow you to board a boat by arrangement with a nun if it’s for the purpose of crossing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.15.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.15.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṅgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk boards a boat by arrangement with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.6.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.10.pli: “abhiruhāma, bhagini, abhiruhāmāyya; abhiruhāmāyya, abhiruhāma, bhagini; ajja vā hiyyo vā pare vā abhiruhāmā”ti saṃvidahati āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.10.eng: if he makes an arrangement like this: he says, “Let’s board, Sister,” and she replies, “Yes, let’s board, venerable;” or she says, “Let’s board, venerable,” and he replies, “Yes, let’s board, Sister;” or he says, “Let’s board today,” “Let’s board tomorrow,” “Let’s board the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.11.pli: Bhikkhuniyā abhiruḷhe bhikkhu abhiruhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.11.eng: If the monk boards when the nun has already boarded, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.12.pli: Bhikkhumhi abhiruḷhe bhikkhunī abhiruhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.12.eng: If the nun boards when the monk has already boarded, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.13.eng: If they both board together, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.15.eng: for the purpose of going against the stream.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.17.eng: for the purpose of going with the stream.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.18.eng: Except for the purpose of crossing:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.19.eng: unless it is to go across.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.20.pli: Kukkuṭasampāte gāme, gāmantare gāmantare āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.20.eng: When the inhabited areas are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next inhabited area he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.21.pli: Agāmake araññe, aḍḍhayojane aḍḍhayojane āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.21.eng: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.21.comm: “Six kilometers” renders addhayojana, “half a yojana”. For further discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.1.pli: Saṃvidahite saṃvidahitasaññī ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhati uddhaṅgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.1.eng: If there is an arrangement, and he perceives that there is, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.2.pli: Saṃvidahite vematiko ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhati uddhaṅgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.2.eng: If there is an arrangement, but he is unsure of it, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.3.pli: Saṃvidahite asaṃvidahitasaññī ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhati uddhaṅgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.3.eng: If there is an arrangement, but he does not perceive that there is, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.4.pli: Bhikkhu saṃvidahati, bhikkhunī na saṃvidahati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.4.eng: If the monk makes an arrangement, but the nun does not express her agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.5.eng: If there is no arrangement, but he perceives that there is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.6.eng: If there is no arrangement, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.7.eng: If there is no arrangement, and he does not perceive that there is, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.2.eng: if it is for the purpose of crossing;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.3.eng: if they board without an arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.4.eng: if the nun has made an arrangement, but he has not expressed his agreement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.5.eng: if they board, but not according to the arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.9.eng: The training rule on boarding boats, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:0.5.eng: 29. The training rule on had prepared

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī aññatarassa kulassa kulūpikā hoti niccabhattikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was associating with a family from which she received a regular meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.3.pli: Tena ca gahapatinā therā bhikkhū nimantitā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.3.eng: Now on one occasion the head of that family had invited some senior monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.4.pli: Atha kho thullanandā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ gahapatiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.4.eng: On the same day, the nun Thullanandā robed up in the morning, took her bowl and robe, and went to that family. And she asked the head of the family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.5.eng: “Why have you prepared so much food?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.6.eng: “’Cause, venerable, I’ve invited the senior monks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.8.pli: “Ayyo sāriputto ayyo mahāmoggallāno ayyo mahākaccāno ayyo mahākoṭṭhiko ayyo mahākappino ayyo mahācundo ayyo anuruddho ayyo revato ayyo upāli ayyo ānando ayyo rāhulo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.8.eng: “Venerable Sāriputta, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, Venerable Mahākaccāna, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhika, Venerable Mahākappina, Venerable Mahācunda, Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Revata, Venerable Upāli, Venerable Ānanda, and Venerable Rāhula.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.9.pli: “Kiṃ pana tvaṃ, gahapati, mahānāge tiṭṭhamāne ceṭake nimantesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.9.eng: “But why do you invite such inferior monks instead of the great ones?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.11.pli: “Ayyo devadatto ayyo kokāliko ayyo kaṭamodakatissako ayyo khaṇḍadeviyā putto ayyo samuddadatto”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.11.eng: “Venerable Devadatta, Venerable Kokālika, Venerable Kaṭamodakatissaka, Venerable Khaṇḍadeviyāputta, and Venerable Samuddadatta.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.12.pli: Ayaṃ carahi thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā antarā kathā vippakatā, atha te therā bhikkhū pavisiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.12.eng: While this conversation was taking place, the senior monks entered.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.13.eng: Thullanandā said, “Is it true that you’ve invited these great monks?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.14.pli: “Idāneva kho tvaṃ, ayye, ceṭake akāsi; idāni mahānāge”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.14.eng: “Just before you called them inferior and now you call them great.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.15.eng: And that lay person threw her out of the house and made an end of her regular meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.16.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.16.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.17.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.17.eng: “How could Devadatta eat almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.18.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, devadatta, jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.18.eng: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.21.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.21.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.23.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.23.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.24.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.24.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.25.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:1.25.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu rājagahā pabbajito ñātikulaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a monk who had earlier left Rājagaha returned to see his family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.2.pli: Manussā—“cirassampi bhadanto āgato”ti sakkaccaṃ bhattaṃ akaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.2.eng: Because it was a long time since he had last returned, people prepared food for him respectfully.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.3.pli: Tassa kulassa kulūpikā bhikkhunī te manusse etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.3.eng: And the nun who was associating with that family said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.6.pli: “bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjitun”ti kukkuccāyanto na paṭiggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.6.eng: “The Buddha has prohibited us from eating almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared,” and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not accept it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.7.eng: And because he was unable to walk for alms, he missed his meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.8.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.8.eng: After returning to the monastery, he told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.9.eng: and they in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.11.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, pubbe gihisamārambhe jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.11.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.12.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.12.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.13.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjeyya, aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:2.13.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared, except if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti aññe vā tassa ārocenti sā vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the nun has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.6.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, sā vā āroceti, presumably refers to the nun telling the monk directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.8.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.10.pli: pubbe adātukāmānaṃ akattukāmānaṃ— “ayyo bhāṇako, ayyo bahussuto, ayyo suttantiko, ayyo vinayadharo, ayyo dhammakathiko, detha ayyassa, karotha ayyassā”ti esā paripāceti nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.10.eng: if she says to those who do not already want to give or want to prepare, “This monk is a reciter,” “This monk is learned,” “This monk is an expert on the discourses,” “This monk is an expert on the Monastic Law,” “This monk is an expounder of the Teaching;” “Give to this monk,” “Prepare for this monk”—this is called “has it prepared”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.12.eng: any of the five cooked foods.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.13.eng: Except if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.14.eng: unless the householder had intended to prepare it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.15.eng: The householder had intended to prepare it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.16.pli: ñātakā vā honti pavāritā vā pakatipaṭiyattaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.16.eng: they are relatives or they have invited or they give regularly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.17.pli: Aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā bhuñjissāmīti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.17.eng: If he receives it with the intention of eating it, except if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.1.18.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.1.pli: Paripācite paripācitasaññī bhuñjati, aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.1.eng: If a nun had it prepared, and he perceives it as such, and he eats it, except if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.2.pli: Paripācite vematiko bhuñjati, aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.2.eng: If a nun had it prepared, but he is unsure of it, and he eats it, except if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.3.pli: Paripācite aparipācitasaññī bhuñjati, aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.3.eng: If a nun had it prepared, but he does not perceive it as such, and he eats it, except if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.4.pli: Ekatoupasampannāya paripācitaṃ bhuñjati, aññatra pubbe gihisamārambhā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.4.eng: If a nun who is fully ordained only on one side had it prepared, and he eats it, except if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.5.eng: If a nun did not have it prepared, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.6.eng: If a nun did not have it prepared, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.2.7.eng: If a nun did not have it prepared, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.3.2.eng: if the householder had intended to prepare it anyway;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.3.3.eng: if a trainee nun has it prepared;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.3.4.eng: if a novice nun has it prepared;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.3.5.eng: if it is anything apart from the five cooked foods;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc29:3.3.8.eng: The training rule on had prepared, the ninth, is finished.
